favourite.article: I was sitting in church today and listening to the message about how we are not to dwell on our past. Instead we are to look to the future and this song just came to me. I remember singing it in church as a child.

A beautifully written hymn full of humility, sacrifice and trust in the Lord. I recall singing it as a young girl at the First United Methodist Church in downtown Gadsden and it brings back dear memories.
Great song
Great song when it's sung, He keeps me moving strong more and more for Jesus, a wonderful song.
Oh, Lord, even as a child this hymn captured me and again as a young adult recommitting afresh to You. Thank You for Your faithfulness to woo and draw our hearts anew to You.

Oh Lord take my life and make me useful for Thy kingdom in Jesus Name. Take my Love and take my will. Take my hands and take my voice. Let them all be used for your glory in Jesus Name Amen. Take my heart and make it whole. Plant Your love in my heart and lead me through in Jesus Name. Thanks for uploading this song and God bless you all. Shalom!!!
This hymn provides me the answer for how my life is to be lived, fully obedient to my Lord and Savior Jesus! I saved these words on my phone and sing this hymn daily!

Oh my, a powerful hymn to be sung always, because it draws me closer to the LORD. It is an assurance that when we allow our lives; heart, mind, body, abilities to be taken by the MASTER, then we are complete for worship.

Oh Lord, I sing praises to You with all believers in this world. May our lives distinctly give the aroma of Your love and grace to a world in desperate need. JESUS, may my life sing to You and my surroundings with every word of this spirit-filled song.

Awesome

Great hymn. As we sang it this morning for the graduating class, I could identify with every line. Thank you so much Frances for these words of consecration.

Father, You are my everything today, tomorrow & forever. I love You, I cherish You. I wish I could sing this love song to You all the day of life. Thank You Jesus for saving my soul.

Ditto to Victor Nwaiwu (Rivers, Nigeria) and Ruth Odondi (Nairobi, Kenya). Great song of total submission. Always a reminder to me of whose I am.

Thank you for reminding me of this song and its wordings, cause it always comes to my memory since I knew it as far back as elementary school days. God be praised and God bless you in keeping a world of love and peace, harmony and brotherhood.

May this be out daily and even moment by moment reality! Only He can be such a One in us. Lord Jesus we love You!
The hymn is one that reminds us of whose, we are, what we are and what is important as we take our journey to Heaven.
One of the most beautiful hymns I have ever heard, this encourages me to enjoy the dedication of my life to Christ :)
Very good gospel song for our dedication to our only Savior and Lord Jesus Christ. Much tribute to all who labored to make this song the way it is.
This song reminds me that I belong to Jesus, and that daily I should give myself wholly to Him.
I love this song with my heart. it inspires me to know whom I am for.
This song rocks.

I love this hymn so much. I beleive all Christians need it every day. God bless the composer of this hymn.

Am filled with joy any time I sing this special hymn. I thank God for choosing you as the vessel for this inspirational kingdom hymn. It is a life changing hymn pointing one at giving himself ABSOLUTELY and only ABSOLUTELY to God in exchange, that is God taking over you and you taking over God. More anointing Pastor Eke Emmanuel Chukwukadibia

I covert a truly yielded heart like the one that birthed this song. As you enjoy the blessing and serenity the song unleashes into your spirit, please also pause briefly to pray for me and for the many who so desire, that we will receive the grace and the tenacity to truly yield our ALL to God for His good pleasure.

Lord raise men up in these days that will shake the earth for your glory. - In respond to this song I pray. A-men!

The prolific British hymnwriter Frances Ridley Havergal wrote this hymn on 2/4/1874. "I went for a little visit of 5 days to Areley House," she explained. "There were 10 persons in the house, some unconverted and long prayed for, some converted but not rejoicing Christians. He gave me the prayer, 'Lord, give me all in this house!' And He just did. Before I left the house, everyone had got a blessing. The last night of my visit I was too happy to sleep, and passed most of the night in praise and renewal of my own consecration, and these little couplets formed themselves and chimed in my heart one after another, till they finished with 'Ever, only, ALL for Thee.'" As Frances wrote the words she capitalized ALL. Two months earlier, she had made a complete surrender of herself to Christ and experienced "the blessedness of true consecration." She wrote, "I just yielded myself to Him, and utterly trusted Him to keep me." - Great Songs of Faith by Brown & Norton

Don’t be deceived, no man can prosper beyond the state of his heart because as a man thinks in his heart, so is he (Prov. 23:7). No wonder so many of us have been struggling in order to fulfill our calling without any result to show for it.

The LORD allowed me to awaken very early this morning in order to spend some uninterrupted time alone with Him. This is a rarity as a stay at home mother of three young children! As I was praying and asking the Holy Spirit to reveal to me what I need to change in my life to become more Holy, this song sprung to my mind. I haven't heard it since I was a child, and the lyrics resonated with the longing in my soul. "Take myself and I will be ever only all for Thee!"

As I meditated and prayed, saying I put God at the center of my life, I put out my left hand and asked to be touched, for a response, silently said, "Come, Holy Spirit, Come." This hymn sprang into my mind, heart, and being. How wonderful, awesome, unknown yet ever present is the Creator.

Take my All and make it thine Lord Jesus.
